Posts.Title: Wockhardt brand 20mg Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: I had 15 sessions last November at The Spire centre in Bristol and was advised to use Aveeno cream (oncologist also works for NHS hospital in Bath). I slapped it on at least 3 times a day and drank at least 2 litres of water a day and had no problems. I got a little pink and had a slight rash during the last week but Piriton took care of it. Within 2 weeks of finishing, skin was fine and 6 months on, no lasting effects. Good luck with your treatment

Posts.Title: How to tell my 13 yr old daughter?

Posts.Content: I went private for my rads and wanted a copy of my pathology report in case it hadn't been sent. I asked one of the BCNs who said she'd post it, I chased and still didn't receive it so went to the hospital and waited until someone printed it out for me. I was frustrated it was a challenge but glad I got it as it confirmed size of lump and that it was estrogen positive enough to make persevering with Tamoxifen worthwhile. My advice would be to do the same, ask and keep asking in person if necessary. It's your report after all. Good luck and cyber hugs

Posts.Content: I finished 3 weeks rads last Friday and had no problems. Skin got slightly sore and this week I've got a slight rash but antihistamine is doing the trick. I was told to use Aveeno cream 3 times a day and I put lots on. I was also told to drink 2 litres of water (or other non caffeine drinks) a day. Hope you're as lucky if you go for it. Big hugs xx
